description.$t: Rambler lost his leg after having been shot but that hasn't stopped him from being a playful affectionate guy. He can play a little rough so he would be best in a home with no kids. As well an experienced dog owner with large dog experience would be best. Now Rambler isn't a dog to take jogging or for long walks but he does have a lot of love and affection to give. Rambler has had a rough time but with the right family he could make a great companion. He is looking for the loving home he is so deserving of.

George has not had an easy life so far as evidenced by the fact he is missing one of his ears. George somehow ended up in a shelter in Thailand with 5000 other dogs from which he was rescued. Who knows the hardships and horrors he's experienced so far in his life. And though he has experienced so much he is still a sweet gentle soul. George is good with other dogs but not with dogs who are going to bully him or be too in his face. As well George is a little older at about 8 years of age so we will not be charging our normal adoption fee. A donation to the organization in Thailand though would be appreciated. George is neutered and up to date on all vaccinations. We hope to find a caring, loving home that this sweet boy is so deserving of. Its been a long hard journey for George but with your help his journey can have a happy ending. For information on adopting George email us at firefighterdogrescue@gmail.com

Toby
Male/Neutered/$425
Breed Guess: Hound mix
Age: 1 year
Weight: 14.5kg

Toby is a joy! Since coming to Canada, he has learned sit and down:  he is very smart dog and loves to learn. He does have energy at times, but he knows when its time to settle down and cuddle (foster mom appreciates his manners!). He is doing very well with house training, and he is crate trained. He has a great personality and he's soft as a teddy bear.  Toby is a fun loving guy that will make a great family member.

We are so proud of him as his rescue story was sad.  Toby was found wandering in a stadium and a man was trying to scare him away with a broom. Toby was on his back being submissive before a wonderful lady stopped the man from hurting him. Lucky for Toby, he entered a rescue and soon came to Canada. Toby is a super happy, playful guy that loves people, likes other dogs and cats.

For more information, please email foster mom whitepaws@rogers.com or fill an application on our web site www.dibsrescue.com

Sweet September has had the worse luck EVER but things are looking up for her starting today !!
She is approximately 5 years old and has been spayed and vaccinated.  Her story is this:
Surrendered by owner who left her outside 24/7.
Not spayed, now done.
Tested positive for heartworm, was treated, clean bill of health and now negative !!
Had  mange, was treated and now negative.  
Lost an eye in a medical emergency, vets just removed it this week so that is good !
Please email ajaxpetcare@hotmail.com for more info or to come meet her.  $300 adoption fee applies with 100 percent of the adoption fee going back to the shelter in the States who saved her life.
Good with most dogs but not all.  Is extremely stressed at the kennel.  No kids under 12 as we don't know her background.

Two little girls need homes (separately).  Both come from a high kill shelter and are very affectionate.  Approx 12 weeks old they are both little girls.  
$500 adoption fee applies which covers the first vaccines and the spay at the Newmarket OSPCA.  
PLEASE email ajaxpetcare@hotmail.com for more info or to set up an appointment to come meet them.

Simcoe is an amazing dog with a larger than life personality! She'll chase a ball with you, follow you through the woods and then snuggle up nice and close on the couch. She's a little excited by car rides and it's a good idea to buckle her in. Who can blame her? The car takes you to fun places! 

Simcoe is a 7 year old, energetic, fun, happy, playful dog looking for a forever home. She loves to walk, loves people and loves to play. Simcoe does enjoy playing large, calm dogs, but she can be overwhelming for small dogs. She just doesn't know her own size! We will require a home where Simcoe is the only dog. While she will play outside, she doesn't like to have doggy friends in her home. 

If you would like to meet Simcoe, please email us to start the conversation. Please note that Simcoe is being fostered in the Bowmanville area and you must be able to travel there to meet her. We require that you complete an adoption application prior to meeting any of our dogs. An adoption fee will apply at time of adoption.

Found north of Zephyr on Leitch Road. This friendly hound female is approximately 5 yrs old and has lots of love to give. She may have been running loose for some time as she was a bit thin. Zoey is spayed and available for adoption now! Adoption applications now being accepted in person at the shelter. A fenced yard is a requirement to adopt - hounds are notorious for following their noses!   :)

Jenny is a beautiful American Bulldog.  She is approximately 3 years old. She is a very energetic girl and is easily motivated. She has a very big heart and is very sweet once she trusts you. She loves to play ball and is a big goofy girl.
Jenny has some social issues and takes a bit to warm up to strangers. With a proper introduction she relaxes quickly. We are working with her on an ongoing basis to recondition her socially.
What we are seeking for Jenny in an adopter is:
-experienced and confident person(s)
-very physically active lifestyle that would include Jenny. 
-someone dedicated to join in on her training sessions and continue working with her
-ability to follow protocols
Jenny is OK with DOGS (with proper intros)
NO kids
NO cats

For an adoption application, please visit our website at www.benevolentbullyrescue.com.  For further info about our organization please also visit our Facebook page at www.facebook.com/benevolentbullyrescue  Please note we do not adopt outside of the Province of Ontario.  Benevolent Bully Rescue's standard adoption fee is $500.00.

Meet Brady!  

Brady is an Alabama boy who just turned 4 years old.  He's a handsome guy as you can see. Brady is very affectionate and loving with the people he knows but sometimes can be a little shy and overwhelmed in an unknown environment.  His ideal home would be one where he will get lots of attention and love.  He'll give it back in spades!  

He's being fostered with another greyhound at the moment but he would be totally fine being an only dog.  His foster Mom and brother are bringing out his playful spirit and his confidence is building every day.

If you would like more information on Brady or would like to meet him, please contact adoption@afterthetrack.ca

Please keep sharing! Since yesterday, this post reached almost 22k people but we have still not had a single request for an adoption application. :( 

Folks, Hope and Lidia have had very little adoption interest and are UDR's longest case. We need your help by sharing these two girls and finding them a forever home. We realize that finding a home for two dogs is harder than just one but this mother/daughter duo are very bonded and they don't want to be split apart. From an adoption standpoint, they are great company and entertainment for each other. They're the perfect size (45-50lbs) and very little trouble. 

Lidia is a pointer/husky mix and is Hope's mom. Hope's father was a purebred Border Collie. They are both spayed and vaccinated. Lidia is 2.5 and Hope is 1.5 years old. They have been raised with children. Both are housetrained and crate trained and are very intelligent dogs. They are used to country-living and so they need some work on leash manners. A Halti, patience, and consistent one-on-one walks will do them wonders. They live with two cats but do like to chase cats. A home with a fully fenced yard for them to relax in would be great. They love the outdoors. They would prefer to be the only dogs in the home as this is what they've always known and they have had little exposure to other dogs. Two is lots of dog anyway! :) 

Please message us if you can offer these two lovely dogs a forever home. They're located in Guelph, ON.

Goofy is a sweet and friendly cocker mix. He weighs about 30 pounds and is almost seven years old. His parents are divorcing and they can't care for him any longer. He is neutered and up to date on his shots. Goofy gets along with other dogs and cats but would do best as the only dog as he is starved for affection.  He absolutely adores children. So we are looking for a home for him with children and no other dog and with someone who works from home or where he isn't left alone for long hours.   If you are interested please contact our rescue at C4PToronto@gmail.com for an application and more information to go meet this sweet boy.

Triton was found by the side of a road with his sister and mom. He and his sister had been hit by a car. His sister didn't make it and the mom was trying to get the sister to eat some chicken she had found to feed her babies. The mom has been adopted by a wonderful family in Toronto. Now we need a wonderful family for this sweet 8 month old boy.  He is neutered and up to date on his shots. He weighs 18 kg.  He is wonderful and active and recovered from his injuries. We are looking for a home with time to spend with this little guy. Please contact our rescue for more info on our foster to adopt program and our application at C4PToronto@gmail.com.

Theresa is a sweet calm two year old dog. She was rescued in the Dominican Republic and is being fostered in Toronto.  She loves children and is good with dogs and cats. She weighs about 30 pounds.  She is shy and hesitant at first but with patience and love she warms up. She has so much love to give. She is healthy, spayed and up to date on her shots. She urgently needs a home so she can start to bond and gain confidence. Please contact our rescue at C4PToronto@gmail.com.

Tiki and his brother Timon are two years old. They are both healthy active young dogs. They are friendly and get along with people and other dogs. We aren't sure how they are with cats. They were rescued with their mom Fiona from a desperate situation in Greece and given all their shots and neutered.  They are arriving in February and we are looking for foster to adopt homes for their arrival. They can all be adopted to separate homes. Tiki and Timon have boundless energy and would do great with an active family or couple or single person. A fenced in yard or lots of time in a dog park and walks would be wonderful. They would do great in obedience and agility training. If you are interested please contact our rescue at C4PToronto@gmail.com for our application and to learn more about our foster to adopt program.

Fiona is a five year old spayed female. She is adorably sweet. She is healthy and up to date on all shots. She is calm and friendly and would be wonderful in any home. She gets along with people and other dogs but we don't know how she is with cats. She was rescued from a bad situation with her sons Tiki and Timon who are two..  They are arriving in February and we are looking for foster to adopt homes for their arrival. They can all be adopted to separate homes.  If you are interested please contact our rescue at C4PToronto@gmail.com for our application and to learn more about our foster to adopt program.

Richard is a sweet active two year old dog. He was rescued in the Dominican Republic. He loves children and is good with dogs.  He hasn't been around cats. He weighs about 45 pounds.  He is healthy, neutered and up to date on his shots. He is a happy and friendly boy who urgently needs a foster to adopt home. Please contact our rescue at C4PToronto@gmail.com.

Jada was rescued in Georgia on the side of a busy rural highway with her puppies. All but one was taken by the ones that rescued her and they were put in a closed high kill kennel at animal control. We rescued them and are looking for a wonderful family for Jada and her puppy Willow. They are healthy, spayed and up to date on shots. Jada is small, only about 35 pounds, and shy and just wants to be loved. She urgently needs a foster to adopt home with her puppy. Please contact our rescue at C4PToronto@gmail.com.

Coco and Cana are sisters that need to be adopted together. They are two years old and sweet as can be. They love children and walk great on leashes. They are housebroken, spayed and up to date on shots.  They were rescued in the Dominican Republic and are in a foster home in Toronto and ready for a meet and greet.  They  are good with dogs but  have not been around cats. They weigh about 23 pounds.  They love to play and they are so fun to watch.  If you live in the Greater Toronto area please contact our rescue at C4PToronto@gmail.com for information and our application.

Rocky was found by soldiers on the Greek border.  He had been shot and the doctors amputated his right front leg. He is in a foster home there and needs a home. He loves people but prefers to be the only animal in the home. He is neutered and healthy and up to date on all his shots. He is  approx. 2-3 years old . and 30 kilo.  Rocky is a strong, proud boy and would love to have a family of his own. He can be very cuddly and is good with kids. If you are interested in being a home for this courageous dog please contact our rescue to learn more about him and our foster to adopt program at C4PToronto@gmail.com.

Teddy is an amazing dog. He is almost two years old, neutered, healthy and up to date on all shots.  He is house trained and walks on a leash. He loves other dogs. He weighs about 50 pounds. Teddy loves to run and play.  We are looking for a family with another high energy dog or an active runner, walker or hiker who can give him regular exercise. He was surrendered because his owner didn't have time to spend with him. He is looking to bond with someone and would do great with an active single person or couple. Because of his energy level, youth and lots of changes for him we are looking for someone with dog experience, calm environment, commitment, stability and patience. Teddy's boundless enthusiasm and capacity for love will bring so much joy to the right home. Please contact our rescue as soon as possible to meet him by emailing C4PToronto@gmail.com.

Jonas is a sweet boy looking for a calm and loving home. He is three years old, 60 pounds, neutered, up to date on shots, house trained and walks well on a leash. He was surrendered because he has a heart condition and the family had a very active household. Jonas can go for walks but should not have strenuous exercise. A home with no other pets, or perhaps another calm, older dog and older children would be best.  Jonas needs someone to love and care for him. He is so deserving and right now is in a kennel. He needs a home as soon as possible.  A single person or couple with a quiet home and love to give would be wonderful too. Please contact our rescue as soon as possible to meet him by emailing C4PToronto@gmail.com.

Lady is a sweet and healthy two year old. Her daughter Amy is almost a year. Amy had a disease and lost her sight and one eye had to be removed. Amy has become happy and more independent in foster care. She is energetic and you can't even tell she is blind.  We are looking for a home for both together. They are happy sweet girls. Young, spayed, up to date on their shots. Just precious. Please contact our rescue Cause 4 Paws Toronto for more information. Our email is C4PToronto@gmail.com..

Vivi was a happy dog till her owner left the country and abandoned her in the house they were renting ..she starved and worse of all a neighbour shot her in the face...We found her, her face full of blood and unfortunately both her eyes destroyed ...imagine ...she was born fine and lost her sight in one day! Why? Nobody can imagine why a person would do such a thing.. Vivi is a very healthy dog.  Spayed and up to date on all shots. She loves food a lot.  By now she knows all the dogs and people in the house so she does not hide anymore and she loves to cuddles.  She deserves a nice life.  In the foster home with so many dogs and with many new dogs all the time, she needs to get used to new smells all the time. She is very brave for a young two year old dog. We are looking for that special home and will waive our adoption fee to help with additional costs. We have an excellent  trainer who will work with a family to help her adjust. Blind dogs usually become so good at compensating it's sometimes hard to tell they are blind.  She is up to date on shots and spayed. She gets along with the other dogs and would be good with respectful children. Please contact our rescue Cause 4 Paws Toronto at C4PToronto@gmail.com for more information about her and our foster to adopt program.

Name(s): Theo
Age: 18 months
Size (weight): 12 lbs.
Coat & colour: Short-haired, black and tan
Temperament: Spunky, loves attention.  Likes to bark so not suitable for an apartment.
Good with Dogs: Yes
Good with Cats: No, will chase cat
Good with Kids: Older, respectful children (11 and older)
Needs another Dog: Nice but not necessary: Needs to be an only Dog: Fine either way
Housetraining: Work in progress; good but not perfect
Suitable for an Apartment: No, if left alone Theo will bark and howl.
Origin: Owner surrender
Adoption Fee? 400.00

 

And now a few words from me:

Hi there, I'm Theo the Doxie-Pin (Dachshund x Miniature Pinscher). Im a 12 lb bundle of energy who loves cuddling. I especially like napping on the big bed with my foster mom.  I will snuggle right in and get under the covers if she lets me.  I can jump very high and getting onto the bed and couch is easy for me. Im good with my canine foster siblings, but would rather chase the family cat than be his friend, so a home without a cat might be best!  I love, love, love my toys.  If they squeak, I am quick to remove the squeaker!  I am a very nice guy that occasionally needs some time to warm up to people.  I will bark at strangers -- they might be dangerous you know!  If you are looking for a handsome guy with lots of get-up-and-go and who also enjoys snuggling and watching movies, then Im your guy.

 


And now a few words from my foster family:

Theo is a happy little guy who is super cuddly and a joy to have around.  He loves his people and wants nothing more than to be right next to you all the time. Theo can run like the wind and whips around the house and yard with no problem.  When not in a fenced yard, he must be on a leash.  For the most part he does his potty outside, but in the colder weather he will need a coat.  Theo has a healthy bark that he is not afraid to use. He has a good recall and knows what "no" means. He is fine with other small to medium size dogs but will chase the house cat if given the chance.  He has a high prey drive. He likes his car rides and would prefer to sit with you rather than ride in the back seat.  Theo is still young, so needs patience and training to help him become the best dog he can be. He will be a wonderful companion in his forever family.

Name(s): Petey
Age: 10 years old
Size (weight): 16 lbs.
Coat & colour: Double Dapple; white, brown and black
Temperament: Good energy level, high prey drive, unpredictable around small dogs, housetrained, loves humans. Needs a confident owner who will give him rules and boundaries.
Good with Dogs: Big dogs possible; NO small dogs.
Good with Cats: NO; high prey drive and cannot be with cats or rodents
Good with Kids: Yes to 12 years and older
Needs another Dog: NO.  Must be an only dog.
Needs to be an only Dog: Yes.  Must be an only dog.
Housetraining: Yes; has the odd accident at night in his crate
Suitable for an Apartment: Could be a possibility
Origin: Owner surrender
Adoption Fee? $250.00
 
And now a few words from me:
Well hello there, my name is Petey and I am in need a forever home. I have already had two homes in my lifetime; the last one loved me but I did not like the visiting children. I am true to my breed and breeding. You see I am a Double Dapple, which gives me some unique qualities, such as my colouring.  I am handsome and very distinguished looking.  But being a Double Dapple can also mean visual and hearing impairments.  In my case, my vision isnt perfect but my hearing has not been affected.  I love humans more than other animals. This is where I am true to my breed  I am a hunter.  I love to hunt for squirrels, chipmunks and birds etc., and my prey drive extends to cats as well (and I dont mean just to chase them).  I also do not tolerate young or small dogs.  For these reasons, I am best as an only dog.  My favourite pastime, other than being an outdoorsman, is to cuddle and be with my human.  So if you have a spot for me to be your one and only fur family member, Im your guy!
 
And now a few words from my foster family:
Petey is a great character, but he really needs to be an only pet in the house. His prey drive towards wildlife is high, and while on walks he is always on guard for squirrels and chipmunks lurking about.  Petey does not tolerate cats at all.  While he has learned to be around other dogs, small dogs and young dogs are not his thing.  He should not be spending time at dog parks.  His ideal home would include the following:  a low level of activity (due to his visual impairment he is not always sure what is happening around him); no other pets; and dog-savvy kids that are 12 years and older.  A retired human(s) or someone single that is looking for a great solo companion would be the ideal home situation for Petey.
